rg.eclipse.jface.action.ExternalActionManager$CommandCallback.isActive(ExternalActionManager.java:297)

are warning exceptions from the command handler and are unrelated.

com.intuit.engines.tpe.tools.workbench.main.TpeLog.info(TpeLog.java:131)

is throwing a null pointer exception and several of the related plug-ins are unable to load due to an error finding classes

java.lang.InstantiationException: com.intuit.engines.tpe.tools.workbench.actions.CompileFileAction

which is likely why you are getting the exceptions from the command handler

The jface exception you are getting is that it is unable to load one of our standard images. Are you running with a modified version of the ide plug-in?

The Action classes are there! and their lib included in the MANIFEST.MF Bundle-ClassPath. furthermore my actions work as I said just it throws these exceptions for no reason. anyhow this is not my main concern nor the TpeLog exception (I left you comments in the .log which exceptions are relevant).
My main concern is the error popups that make the application unusable especially when you try a bulk operation that update the problem marker then you get tens of these. I'm not running a modified platform, I use the 3.2RC3 platform binary eclipse-platform-3.2RC3-win32.zip with the perforce plugin. I will try 3.2RC4 and let you know.

The harmless action exceptions I was seeing since 3.1 but the error popups started showing from 3.2M5a to 3.2RC3. I could guess that action exceptions happen because the definitions are loaded before the OSGI bundle is initialized. but that's speculation. let me know if you still need another fresh log.

I have loaded the RC4 RCP install and the plug-in you mentioned and there are some issues

First of all the ui component is wrong - there should be a dependency on ide it doesn't have for 

<!-- Marker Resolutions -->
   <extension
         point="org.eclipse.ui.markerResolution">
      <markerResolutionGenerator
            markerType="com.perforce.team.core.perforceadd"
            class="com.perforce.team.ui.markers.PerforceResolutionGenerator">
      </markerResolutionGenerator>
   </extension>

org.eclipse.ui.markerResolution is org.eclipse.ui.ide.markerResolution

<!-- Help contexts -->
   <extension
         point="org.eclipse.help.contexts">
      <contexts
            name="contexts.xml">
      </contexts>
   </extension>

is also incorrect markup. This doesn't seem to be affecting launching perforce installed into the SDK but these values will be dropped.

Also I don't know what you are using for an application to launch this as the RCP install does not come with one. I assume you have some other plug-in. I have run it with the platform ide and platform sdk products and I am not getting any problems on startup or when I create any errors.

To replicate this I'll need to know what you are installing besides RCP and perforce and how you are launching it. I'll also need steps to make this problem happen.

I agree it looks like an issue but I need to determine the cause first. Arrays are not grown in the MarkerAdapter for performance reasons they are replaced so I suspect the problem is with our error handling of marker creation.

Until I have some steps to replicate this problem I can't investigate any furthter.

I can reproduce with eclipse-platform-3.2RC4-win32 and no plugins. It is extremely hard to give you a reproducible testcase. I believe the ArrayIndexOutOfBound and the null image are obvious ones and can be fixed without a testcase. also please note how the marker view display of errors changed since 3.2M5a

a fresh .log from the application-runtime workspace. at startup I see an error popup and "queuing viewer updates" error. after I invoke the CompileAllAction which updates the marker view for each problem encountered it displays as many error popup with null image in .log.

The problem is that neith of them are obvious. The missing image should never happen because the bundle should always load - if this image is missing many others should be missing too.

Same issue with the array of markers. If I don't know how they are created then I can't analyse the code. I'm afraid I can't go making changes late in the game with no idea of thier cause.

Do you have a .log of the issue with RC4? Your last one showed a lot of class loading errors which would potentially cause the missing image.

Also I assume you are doing more than just adding the perforce plug-in an to the RCP install but I have no other information to work with from you.

A couple of other questions:
1) Do you have this problem with the SDK install?
2) Does this happen on startup or are you doing something else ?
3) How are you creating markers?

A really can't proceed without more information as any fix could be totally wrong with no way to verify.

Your screenshot indicates that you are getting none of our images so it looks like my initial analysis about initialization failing might be on the right track.

I assume you are using the SDK not the RCP download as the IDE is not in the RCP download. If so are you just launching using the Eclipse executable or something else? If the IDEWorkbenchAdvisor is not being invoked none of the IDE components will be initialized and you will get issues like this throughout your application anytime you use a view contributed by the IDE plug-in.

Do you have this problem if you switch the problems view to Group by -> None?
See Bug 142802 for the NPE image issue - I modified the code to always through the  NPE but that does not seem to be causing your other issues.

The problem is that to use anything in the IDE you need to use the IDE application. The fact that it worked in 3.1 was luck - we have never supported the IDE as an RCP component.

Subclassing the IDEWorkbenchAdvisor will work but it is internal so things could change without warning so we usually don't recommend it.

However if you want to use IDE component in RCP applications you are stuck with this solution. We should look at something better for the IDE components in 3.3.

I am going to close this as WORKSFORME as I have logged Bug 142846 for us to continue with issue and I don't want people to have to sift through all of our debugging to determine what we are talking about. Please feel free to add yourself to Bug 142846 so that we can continue this conversation there.
Thanks for kicking this issue out to another bug. can we continue the conversation about the action exceptions and MarkerAdapter.MarkerCategory ArrayIndexOutOfBound here?

Sure Ilyiad - are you still getting the IndexOutOfBoundExceptions with the changes to the application?

If so are you getting them when the Grouping is set to Group By - None?

I am not seeing the IndexOutOfBoundException anymore but I thought having the array index as an instance variable in MarkerAdapter.MarkerCategory is asking for trouble. why do we do that! you always know the length of an array and how much to grow it by.
I'm more conserned about the action exceptions that happen at startup but then the actions work after that. at startup I always see (seen since 3.1)
1- The command ("ActionId") is undefined
2- Plug-in was unable to instantiate class "ActionClass"
3- Could not create action delegate for id: "ActionId"
I attached the plugin.xml (to show the action config) and MANIFEST.MF (to show tpe-workbench.jar which has the action classes)

It is so that we do not calculate the array until we need to (i.e. it is expanded). It is a significant space saving if we wait for systems with a lot of errors. We don't ever grow or shrink the array for space performance reasons.

The code is written so that the categories are invalidated during recomputation so you should not have missing indices. I suspect your problem is to do with some uninitialized code that happened when you weren't using the IDEApplication.

Can you attach a .log with the changes to your application that just shows the remaining problems you have (i.e. the messages about the missing actions)?

Yes exactly, after startup the actions work normally when you click on them. I will try removing the activator and let you know.

All of the errors that look like this:
!MESSAGE The command ("workbench.actions.CompileFileAction") is undefined

mean that this code are trying to access a command somewhere, "workbench.actions.CompileFileAction", but it's not defined.  They need to define commands with this ID and link them to the actions.

There's still the NPE:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.intuit.engines.tpe.tools.workbench.main.TpeLog.error(TpeLog.java:86)


Also, in the plugin.xml, they seem to have defined the product twice:
         point="org.eclipse.core.runtime.products">
      <product
            application="com.intuit.engines.tpe.tools.workbench.TDWorkbench"
            name="Tax Developer Workbench">
[... snip ...]
         point="org.eclipse.core.runtime.products">
      <product
            application="com.intuit.engines.tpe.tools.workbench.TDWorkbench"
            name="TDWorkbench">


The one command they have defined, workbench.commands.CompileFile, doesn't match any of the actions, like workbench.actions.CompileFileAction, and isn't linked to any of the actions using the definitionId.  Also they should use org.eclipse.ui.bindings to define keybindings, not stick them in org.eclipse.ui.commands.

And one of their actions uses the attribute 'accelerator="ALT+M"', which has been deprecated for a couple of releases now and can interfere with keybindings.

Later,
PW

(In reply to comment #32)
> what about the can't instantiate the action classes?

Normally, that would indicate a problem with your plugin (but there is usually something about a failed activator then).

The only thing I can suggest is to get a fresh install of 3.2 and a new workspace and get your plugin in the new workspace.  Get rid of the NPEs and undefined command errors).

Then create a launch config and launch.  Then you can see what errors you get from a clean install.

PW
